title: City Provider
name: Hunter
desc: Police Officer who wants to do more, but is unclear about how to connect people to services.

title: High-Score
name: Brian
desc: Has cycled through the system, which allows him to be a navigator for individuals that are newly homeless. Working to get housing.

title: Low-Score
name: Jo & Kaitlyn
desc: Seeking information about paths to affordable housing. C.A. score does not qualify for housing placement.

title: Off the Grid
name: Ximena
desc: Surviving day to day with no support. Legal status and limited English make it hard to trust the system.

title: Service Provider
name: Hailey
desc: Working at a non-profit organization that has contracts with other major service providers. Committed to providing services to individuals experiencing homelessness.

title: Advocate
desc: Wants to inform citywide strategy about homelessness. Needs access to information about the needs of people struggling with homelessess and homelessness policy data.

title: Analyst
desc: Wants to better allocate organizational resources and inform citywide strategy to address homelessness. Needs cross-departmental coordinated data that will allow him to evaluate interventions regarding homelessness.

title: Disconnected
desc: Currently experiencing homelessness. Wants to find and use public services but struggles to find information about how to get a case manager or how to connect to services without a case manager.

title: Navigator
desc: Currently experiencing homelessness. Wants informed referrals to specific service providers and wants to help others connect to services but lacks resources and is unemployed.

title: Referrer
desc: Wants to make informed referrals to specific service providers but does not knowledge of service providers or a reliable channel of communication with providers.

title: Non-Technical User
name: Ned
desc: Council member looking for intuitive understanding of city services such as trash collection, transportation options, city rebate programs

title: Technical User
name: Tanya
desc: Data administrator for Animal Services looking for clean data sets to analze for time-sensitive reports to customers

title: Creator/Publisher
name: Carmen
desc: Data analyst at the planning department who needs timely high quality data to produce spatial and tabular performance reports

title: Special Interest User
name: Steve
desc: Social entrepreneur with tech background. Wants to create marketable product that benefits the community.

title: Data Curator
name: Ava Wright
desc: Data Curator at a public research library. Acquires collections and makes sure they are processed correctly, well described and easy to access.

title: Data Reporter
name: Eva Delgado
desc: Works at a North American newspaper. Part analyst, part developer, part data scientist, produces data-driven stories.

title: Faculty
name: Dr. Kylie Yu
desc: Associate professor of US history at a small liberal arts college. Researches representations of immigrants in the media in the 19th century.

title: High School Teacher
name: Mathew Miller
desc: Math teacher at a suburban high school. Guides student senior projects that work with real-world data.

title: Library Administrator
name: Tejaswinin Sona
desc: Associate University Librarian for Digital Scholarship and Technology. Executes grant-funded projects to create online collections from digitized archives, books, and maps.

title: Metadata Analyst
name: Becky Roberts
desc: Metadata librarian at a large research institution. Analyzes and transforms metadata, ensuring it maintains integrity as it is optimized for end user access.

title: Postdoctorl Researcher
name: Anna Pernod
desc: Interdisciplinary Humanities Postdoc. Learning to use text analysis software to study patterns of word use in french poetry for book.

title: Public Policy Data Analyst
name: Ed Kishiyama
desc: Data analyst at a major immingration NGO in San Francisco. Writing grant to create collaborative international data archive.

title: Repostitory Services Manager
name: Dustin Bishop
desc: Works at a large research institution. Promotes best practices for open repository systems that collect research output.

title: Software Developer
name: Javier Hawkins
desc: Software developer at a large university. Searching for data resources with a documented license to reuse the data to provide digital humanities assistance.

title: Undergraduate Student
name: Julian Santino
desc: Political science major a minor in music.  Assigned to analyze poverty data from Central America with topic modeling.

title: Univeristy Archivist
name: Torsten Melhus
desc: College archivist. Exploring new ways to promote use of the college’s collections, but has limited time and resources.

title: Savvy Sonja
desc: Planner for a mid-sized city government. Analyzes data to find answers to questions and share information with stakeholders.

title: Manager Marco
desc: Administrator for a township. Uses data to share information and understand practical issues.

title: Engaged Elaine
desc: Retiree, neighborhood advocate, watershed protection group board member. Seeks to engage in participatory analysis about areas of expertise.

title: Hopeful Hadiya
desc: Affordable housing nonprofit employee. Wants to understand and communicate housing needs, and demonstrate program impacts.

title: Decisive Delaney
desc: Elected village council member. Looks for accessible data to inform decisions and communicate with residents.

title: Specialist Samir
desc: Project manager for a planning and engineering consulting firm. Needs project-specific data to meet contracted goals and regulatory requirements.

title: Coding Corey
desc: Civic tech enthusiast. Wants to make cool solutions to real community problems with any and all data they can get their hands on.

title: Real Estate Researcher/Consultant
name: Jessie
desc: Real estate consultant. Specializes in appraisal and zoning research and produces reports used by lenders prior to approval of a real estate loan.

title: Community Developer
name: David
desc: Affordable housing developer. wants to make sure that his projects are the best they can be by conducting research.

title: Affordable Housing Developer
name: Joe
desc: Affordable housing developer looking to access zoning reports, new development permits, new affordable housing contracts, housing demand info.

title: Concerned Residents
name: Francis
desc: Civically minded neighborhood volunteer. Has an appetite for information such as property values that will help her make a strong argument.

title: Journalist
name: Perry
desc: Journalist. Reports on local spending, undue influence on government leaders, and is a regular and expert records requestor.

title: Journalist
name: Derek
desc: Reporter. Submits public records requests; needs police statistics, analysis of raw response times data; monitors regularly collected info like notices of claim.

title: Community Lender
name: Lori
desc: Executive director of a non-profit financial intermediary supporting community development. Needs neighborhood indicator data from various sources to inform funding priorites.

title: Capital Improvement Project Market Entrant
desc: Engineering firm employee looking for info about new project solicitations. Wants the city procurement process to even the playing field among vendors.

title: Vendor
desc: Contractor familiar with city. Uses bid aggregators and reads RFPs to find opportunities to provide services and info about City requirements.

title: Construction Company Employee
desc: Architect and Engineering specialist spends a lot of money printing construction proposals. Strongly prefers electronic proposal submissions.

title: Media Publisher
desc: Working in the printing and media business. Apprehensive about revealing the structure of their proposals to competitors.

title: Consultant
desc: Consulting engineer values comparing RFSQ scores and number and size of contracts from competitors to understand their relation to the business landscape.

title: City Staff
desc: Contranct Manager wants to know about available vendors in a timely manner. Lacks confidence in understanding of different solicitation methods i.e. RFPs or RFQs.

title: Departmental Staff
desc: Customer engagement coordinator monitors contract implementationa and receives user feedback. Concerned about process of projects.

title: Community Activist
name: Robert
desc: Neighborhood Association transportation committee member. Wants traffic data to redesign unsafe road, but doesn't know how to access the data.

title: Large Nonprofit Manager
name: Anna
desc: Program manager for early childhood development at a large nonprofit. Analyzes impact of county-wide strategy, but struggles with data access and quality.

title: Small Community-Based Organization Director
name: Barbara
desc: Director of a community-based organization. Needs neighborhood indicators to demonstrate quantitative need and impact of her work.

title: Connector
name: Sylvia
desc: University of Wisconsin community liaison. Connects community organizations to data owners to find specific data at the neighborhood level.

title: Disseminator
name: Julia
desc: Local marketing start-up. Attends public meetings, collects data, analyzes it, shares it in the public domain, but struggles to find data sources.

title: City Staffer
name: Doug
desc: Manages City's application for addressing reported issues. Wants to help residents but struggles with bureaucratic impedimetns to quickly sharing data.

title: Passionate Environmentalist
desc: Works with or for a local community organization. Wants to change behaviors and practices around sea-level rise and related issues.

title: Creative Problem-Solver
desc: Business person, technologist, and expert data user. Flooding at times presents an opportunity for their work.

title: Community Mobilizer
desc: Long-term resident, active in the community. Not a data expert. Concerned about potential damage to home and property, as well as flood insurance.

title: Informed Influencer
desc: Data-savvy policymaker or civil servant. Views flooding as a major issue for the city and wants all the relevant data.

title: On-the-Ground Communicator
desc: Work in media or emergency management. Needs data for immediate information needs of residents.

title: Meticulous Mapper
name: Kent
desc: Lead developer at a small civic mapping startup. Creating app to map schools with lowest attendance levels.

title: Local Liason
name: Roman
desc: Webmaster at nonprofit. Persuading colleagues and community to invest resources in data-driven decision making, and make data available to non-technical residents.

title: Influential Interpreter
name: June
desc: Eviction-prevention policy associate. Interprets data and define use cases for stakeholders i.e. tenants rights organizations and lawyers.

title: Equipped Explorer
name: Marcus
desc: Continuing education tech instructor. Determining use for open data to improve educational opportunity and environmental conservation.

title: Busy Bystander
name: Sarah
desc: College student. Finding ways to apply data insights to family business, and exploring value of open data through class projects.

title: Community Champion
name: Alana
desc: Immigrants' rights advocacy lead organizer. Creating fairer policies for immigrants, and collecting newspaper articles, court rulings to use as evidence in court.

title: City Planner
name: Remi
desc: Updating regional comprehensive plan, reducing disparities between neighborhoods, and increasing community assets.

title: Assistant Hospital Director
name: Tammy
desc: Needs to compile and interpret large amounts of community data – demographics as well as data about health outcomes – currently and over time.

title: Community Organizer (at nonprofit)
name: Barry
desc: Helping his community organize and advocate for change. Wants to get into politics.

title: Project Manager of a CDC
name: Robyn
desc: Helping her neighbors in the Northside, collecting housing stats about the Northside, and building skills to be more marketable.

title: Restaurant Worker, Aspiring Entrepreneur
name: Can
desc: Wants to start restaurant. Wants to use data to find best location for business venture, a franchise location for hot dog shop.

title: Understanding Student (Geology, GIS certificate)
name: Todd
desc: Wants to graduate. Needs to do community-related project that uses GIS. Wants to backpack through all National Parks.

title: Library Mascot/Librarian, part-time student at Pitt's MLIS program
name: Andrew Cardnegie
desc: Wants to help patrons find information. Wants to be more relevant in organization, and own more cats.

title: Sociology faculty
name: Esmerelda
desc: Engaging in community-based participatory research. Incorporating real world data into work, and attempting to get tenure.

title: Junior program officer at a small community foundation
name: Melly
desc: Building capacity of grantees for program development and evaluation. Learning more about region.

title: Civic Technologist
desc: Works in the private sector and might hold a post-baccalaureate degree in engineering, computer science, information technology, or web information technology, or web development.

title: Nonprofit Employee
desc: Has a degree that includes data analysis training or has sought professional development opportunities to learn the skills necessary to access open data systems.

title: City Employee
desc: Tends to have a wide range of data skills. More likely to use the Open Data Portal and/or GeoHub, and has technical data training either through an advanced degree or has sought professional development opportunities to learn the skills necessary to access open data systems.
